hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with 20-day realized volatility below 40% and 10-day ATR compression to <1.5% of price, a downside break of the 20-day Bollinger Band lower bound with >2x average volume will signal a transition to BEAR regime with 70% probability, offering a short entry opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. Volume-confirmed breakdowns through established support (Bollinger Band) suggest institutional selling and regime change initiation. High ETH/BTC correlation confirms broad crypto weakness rather than isolated BTC move.
entry_conditions: BTC closes below 20-day Bollinger Band lower bound (2 std)
Volume on break day > 2x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price reaches -8% from entry OR regime shifts to STRESS (confidence > 70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price reclaims 20-day SMA for 2 consecutive closes
exit_conditions.time_exit: 14 trading days after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such signals result in false breaks (price returns above Bollinger Band within 3 days) OR less than 55% of signals correctly predict BEAR regime within 7 days.
